venue.address_1: 733 Monroe Tpke (Rte 111) at Fan Hill Road
venue.name: Edith Wheeler Library

item.description:
What would you do if there was no cell phone service, no electricity, no clean water, no medicine, store shelves were bare, no dry blankets nor dry clothes - think of everything you use everyday and ask yourself, how would I get along (or survive) without most or all of these.

Please join us for this timely informative talk on how to prepare for disaster caused by mother nature or whatever.  I apologize for the delay, this was originally scheduled to be held last March.

Rebecca Prout a CT CFL member is our speaker for this event. She will discuss the 2nd most important aspect of survival, food; How to store food, not just for 3 - 6 months nor 1 year, but for 3 years.  Clean water is #1.

PLEASE be prompt on arrival as the room is 1pm -4 pm; we can not go over as the library closes at 4 pm. 

Open to the public, please invite everyone that you think would be interested in this kind of information.

PLEASE remember to rsvp.

 

See you there,

barbara g.
item.how_to_find_us: Ehler Meeting Room Lower Level in the back
item.name: How To Series - Preparedness - Long Term Food Storage
